agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 26, 2019 PLACE: E2.036 CHAIR: Rep. Dan Huberty *The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair* *Testimony will be limited to two (2) minutes* HB 17 Bonnen, Greg | et al. Relating to public school safety measures and procedures. HB 366 González, Mary Relating to healthy relationships education in public schools. HB 567 Capriglione Relating to adjustment of a school district's wealth per student under the school finance system to reflect campus security costs. HB 734 Huberty Relating to the carrying of concealed or holstered handguns by certain handgun license holders attending a meeting of the board of trustees of a school district or the governing body of an open-enrollment charter school. HB 876 Allen | et al. Relating to the model training curriculum and required training for school district peace officers and school resource officers. HB 973 Metcalf | et al. Relating to school district compliance with certain school safety measures; providing an administrative penalty. HB 974 Metcalf | et al. Relating to public school safety measures and procedures. HB 975 Metcalf | et al. Relating to training requirements for a member of the board of trustees of an independent school district. HB 976 Metcalf | et al. Relating to public school safety and security measures, policies, and procedures. HB 1026 Bohac Relating to instruction in positive character traits in public schools. HB 1106 Swanson Relating to the number of school marshals that may be appointed to serve on a public school campus or at a private school. HB 1143 Hefner Relating to the transportation or storage of a handgun or other firearm or ammunition by a handgun license holder in a school parking area. HB 1312 Moody Relating to the provision of on-campus mental health services by a school district and reimbursement under Medicaid for certain services provided to eligible students. HB 1387 Hefner Relating to the number of school marshals that may be appointed to serve on a public school campus or at a private school. HB 1467 Talarico | et al. Relating to a mental health professional to school law enforcement official ratio for public schools. HB 1471 Darby Relating to a school security volunteer program. HB 1496 Metcalf | et al. Relating to a notice requirement regarding possible acts of school violence. HB 1623 Coleman Relating to training for public school personnel to identify and intervene if a student suffers from behavioral health issues. HB 1640 Martinez Relating to establishing a pilot program to employ a life skills counselor at public high school campuses in certain counties. HB 1754 Bonnen, Greg | et al. Relating to creating a school safety allotment under the foundation school program. HB 1825 Cortez Relating to information a law enforcement agency is required to share with a school district about a person who may be a student. HB 1959 Hefner Relating to the transportation or storage of a firearm or ammunition by a handgun license holder in a private school parking area. HB 2195 Meyer Relating to an active shooter emergency policy for school districts. HB 2511 Allen Relating to the content of a public school campus improvement plan. HB 2653 Rosenthal Relating to public school policies and procedures for the establishment of threat assessment teams. HB 2654 Rosenthal Relating to building standards for instructional facilities and campus safety procedures for public schools. HB 2655 Rosenthal Relating to an active shooter emergency protocol for public school districts and required active shooter training for school district peace officers and school resource officers. HB 2994 Talarico | et al. Relating to mental health training for public school educators. HB 2997 Talarico | et al. Relating to suicide prevention training for certain public school employees and public school mental health related programs and the applicability of related immunity provisions. HB 3018 Allison Relating to requiring the incorporation of instruction in digital citizenship into the public school curriculum. HB 3235 Ramos Relating to staff development requirements for public educators regarding suicide prevention training. HB 3290 Toth Relating to establishing public school campus special threat response plans. HB 3411 Allison Relating to suicide prevention in public school curriculum and certain educational programs concerning suicide prevention and substance abuse prevention. HB 3470 Allen Relating to the duties of school district peace officers, school resource officers, and security personnel. HB 3718 Parker | et al. Relating to a trauma-informed care policy for school districts and open-enrollment charter schools and training regarding the policy for district and school employees. Bills added after last posting: HB 1623 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
